div.p: Based on guidance from the MA Department of Education, MA Department of Public Health, and Gov. Charlie Baker we have closed the Silver Lake schools for the remainder of the school year. Our anticipated last day of school is June 19, 2020.
Please see this document (click here) for full information and the latest details.

If your child is in need of a Chromebook, or have questions or issues regarding a Chromebook that was already picked up please email distancelearning@slrsd.org. Also, Comcast is offering free wifi through the following program (click here).
Our food services director has simplified the ordering and pickup process for families who have requested lunches during the extended closure. For information on this program click here.
To support students and help them stay connected to their learning over the period of the school closure, we have compiled the learning resources below.

li.a: Silver Lake K-6 Learning Resources (click here)
Silver Lake's Remote Learning Plan (click here)

div.p: For the latest information, scroll through our ParentSquare widget below.

Thank you,
Jill Proulx and Ryan Lynch

div.h2: Silver Lake Regional School District & Superintendency Union #31

p.a: Student Teacher Guidelines, Application, and Observation Log
MCAS Results, Accountability, and DOE School Report Cards
ParentSquare - Getting Started Info for Parents

p.br: In an effort to ensure student health and wellness, we are sending home information regarding the Coronavirus and the Flu. Please see the attached information regarding Coronavirus and the Flu. We want you to know that the schools are doing both routine cleaning and extra cleaning based on the recommendations from the CDC as a preventive measure. Please see the following CDC guidance.
The "meet and greet" with the Superintendent and Assistant Superintendent originally scheduled for 3.16.20 has been postponed. Please see the following for full details and a survey.

p.strong: ParentSquare 101 - Getting Started Info for Parents
p.br: Silver Lake Regional School District has adopted ParentSquare; a communication and organization tool designed to keep parents informed and involved in their children's learning and school activities. We invite you to read some helpful tips on getting started by clicking here!

div.p:
Tentative Last Day of School
The tentative last day of school Friday, June 19, 2020 for Grades K-12.

All schools in the Silver Lake Regional School District including Halifax, Kingston and Plympton use the A.L.I.C.E. protocols. All staff have received training and we practice evacuation and safety drills with our students and staff. We use age appropriate language and processes depending on the age of the students. We are very fortunate to have an excellent working relationship with all our local law enforcement agencies as well as fire departments and work closely with them on our safety protocols and drills. Here is a link to the A.L.I.C.E. website that has some excellent resources and videos. The safety and security of our students and staff is our primary concern.

p.small: Silver Lake Regional School District does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, gender identity, disability, religion or sexual orientation.
